entry.title: How to access 'Posting parameters' tab in 'Manage Contract' app contract screen
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We are currently facing an issue where the Posting Parameters tab is not appearing in the RECN Contract screen.

Could you kindly assist us in identifying:

  • Why the Posting Parameters tab is not visible in our RECN screen?
  • What specific configuration settings or screen layout variants need to be activated to enable this tab?
  • Whether any field group assignments or view variants  are required for this functionality?

We would appreciate your guidance on the necessary steps to resolve this and ensure the tab is available for contract postings.

Thanks & regards.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Construction in Progress (CIP) Process using WBS in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
We are implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and need to understand the Construction in Progress (CIP) process using WBS elements instead of internal orders.

**Our Understanding:**
In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:
1. Investment internal orders are not available
2. We should use WBS elements for CIP instead
3. Process flow: Create CIP WBS → WBS Settlement (post to CIP account) → Final Settlement (post to fixed asset master)

**Our Questions:**
1. Which scope items are required to implement this CIP process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
2. Is there a standard process flow or best practice documentation for CIP management using WBS in Cloud Public Edition?

Could you please provide guidance on the standard configuration and scope items needed for this process?

Thank you.

entry.title: Bank Account derivation from IBAN via API Business Partner "A2X"
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

We are currently integrating SAP with an external system that transmits new Business Partner (Customer/Vendor Master Data) records via the "Business Partner (A2X)" API. In the source system, only the IBAN is maintained. As a result, whenever the master data includes bank details, the data distribution via API fails due to missing mandatory fields such as Bank Country, Bank Key, Bank Account, and Control Key.

Is there a way for SAP to automatically derive or calculate these fields at the time of data distribution? Alternatively, is it possible for the external source system to retrieve the necessary bank account derivation logic from SAP in advance,  prior to sending the data?

Thank you,

Erika

entry.title: Goods movement issue
entry.content:
Hello,

We are using S/4HANA Public Cloud and recently have detected a strange goods movement issue.

Somehow it's possible to post a goods movement for fractional quantity, i.e. if for example we move 5,3 pcs from one plant (storage location) to another one, the system will confirm it without any warning or error message.


Best regards,

Plamen

Shelly Group

entry.title: SOAP API ProductMDMBulkReplicateRequest for creating a product with classification
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We need to create products with related classifications and characteristics via API in S/4 Hana Cloud Public. For with purpose we use standard SOAP API ProductMDMBulkReplicateRequest ( https://api.sap.com/api/PRODUCTMDMBULKREPLICATEREQUEST/overview ). 

But we have a problem: when we're consuming the web service from ABAP Environment ( from custom class from Eclipse ), we get errors  in SOAP Log Message:

 

Log Messages

 
Consumer:
  • Web service processing error; more details in the web service error log on provider side (UTC timestamp 20251027114623; Transact
  • soap-env : http://schemas.xmlsoap. org/soap/envelope/
  • faultcode : soap-env:Server
  • faultstring : Web service processing error; more details in the web service error log on provider side (UTC timestamp 20251027114623; Transa ... Show More
  • lang : en
     
    Provider:
    SRT: Plain SOAP: Reliable messaging (RM) configured, but consumer sends QoS BE request.
     We are trying to call the SOAP web service within SAP: Source and Target both are S4 HANA public cloud system.

 

Here are our actions step-by-step:

1. Created a Communication User in the Maintain Communication Users app  in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition.

2. Created a communication system in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition and added as inbound communication user created in step 1

3.  Created a communication arrangement based on the communication scenario SAP_COM_0009. Deactivate all Outbound Services. And then downloaded WSDL file of Product Master - Replicate from Client to SAP S/4HANA Cloud

4. Created in ADT a service consumption model for the targeted web service from the metadata file from step 3.

5. Created in ADT  an outbound service.

6. Created in ADT  a communication scenario and assign the outbound service to it. Chose the Authentication Methods Basic and X.509.

7.  Then in Communication Arrangements app created another communication arrangement based on our custom communication scenario, as well as a new communication system and an outbound communication user from step 1.

8.  Checked connection: we get "The ping of the outbound service was successful".

9. For the implementation of the outbound call, we used the code sample copied earlier from the service consumption model

I would really appreciate any help. Many thanks in advance for your help.

entry.title: BEJ Inventory Valuation for Year-End Closing - on storage location
entry.content:
Hello, 
is there any chance in SAP Public Cloud to run different valuation practics for different storate locations within one company code/plant?
Best regards
Anja

entry.title: What are the recommended hardware and network requirements for optimal SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edit
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are currently implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition in our company. Since this is a SaaS solution, we understand that SAP manages the infrastructure and servers. However, we want to ensure that our local network and end-user devices provide the best possible experience for our users.

Could you please share:

  1. Recommended specifications for end-user computers (CPU, RAM, OS, browser, etc.).
  2. Network requirements (bandwidth per user, latency, stability considerations).
  3. Any best practices for VPN, QoS, or security settings to optimize connectivity.

Our goal is to avoid performance issues and guarantee smooth access to Fiori apps and other functionalities.

Thank you in advance for your insights!

entry.title: Manage Global Hierarchies
entry.content:
Good evening, I am updating the balance sheet structures in SAP 4/HANA PUBLIC CLOUD using the manage global hierarchies application. I have encountered this error that the system is returning, but I cannot figure out what it corresponds to.

If anyone has encountered this situation and could help me resolve my query, it would be a great help.

I have used this application many times before, but it has never returned this result.

I look forward to your responses. Best regards and thanks in advance.

Juan Antonio Moyano

entry.title: Project Control - Enterprise Projects
entry.content:
Good evening, the other day I had a question while performing a business check in SAP 4/HANA PUBLIC CLOUD.

My question was whether, once the project has been created and released, any PEP elements added later can remain unreleased automatically.

Based on the tests I have been conducting, they are released directly, but I would like to confirm whether there is a way to prevent this from happening once the project has already been released.

On the other hand, also related to the Project Control - Enterprise Projects application, I would be interested to know if there is any way to add applications to the image shown below. From what I have been researching, I would say that it is impossible as it comes as standard...

If anyone could answer these two questions and clarify them for me, it would be a great help to my learning and progress.

I look forward to your responses. Best regards and thanks in advance.

Juan Antonio Moyano

entry.title: In S4 Hana Public Cloud there is only two control keys YBM1 & YBM2 , how to procure external service
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

In S4 Hana Public Cloud there are two control keys YBM1 & YBM2 there is nothing as PM03 as in on premise to procure external services.

In the above mentioned control keys if we add external work center with YBM2 control key its creating PR but that is not as item category D, which will not serve the actual purpose of external service procurement. 

Though  it could be achieved directly by adding Services in Service Overview, by linking external operation, but this is creating an additional extra line in PR which is non relevant to purchasing.

Could anyone help is there any possibility in S4 Public cloud to create a PR with item for SES, automatically from external operations as with control key PM03 (on premise), given there is no order type configuration in S4 Public cloud.

entry.title: Standard Costing Input Parameters in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,
I am working on a Discovery phase project to assess whether SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition can support our client's standard costing process.
I need to confirm if the following input parameters can be configured in the standard costing calculation (Scope Item: BEG - Standard Cost Calculation).
Required Input Parameters:

Design BOM - Bill of Materials created by design department
Production BOM - Bill of Materials with theoretical quantities
Process yield loss rate - Defect rate or scrap rate at manufacturing process level
Actual material consumption quantity - Including material yield/scrap considerations
Manufacturing version - Version control for BOM and routing
Work instructions / Activity types and rates - Labor and machine hour rates
Work center - Production resource master data
Material master - Item master data
Standard material price - Standard purchase price for purchased materials

Questions:

Can all of these parameters be maintained in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
If any of these are not supported in the standard functionality, what are the recommended workarounds or alternative approaches?
Specifically, I'm concerned about process yield loss rate and material yield/scrap - where should these be configured?

Any guidance or reference to documentation would be greatly appreciated.
Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: Manage multiple internal numbers and quantities per Delivery Item in Outbound Delivery Creation
entry.content:
Hello All,

Users need to record and manage multiple internal numbers (internal lot, sub-ID, or internal reference) and corresponding quantities under one delivery item.

The total quantity across all internal numbers should equal the delivery item’s quantity.
Ideally, we would like to create these as add-on fields and add table in Create Outbound Delivery app - Item level but seems couldn't find a way to do it.

Then, we would like to output this on printing template as well

Example Scenario:

  • Outbound Delivery: 80001234

  • Item: 10 (Material ABC-100, 10 pcs total)

  • Internal split required:

Internal No Quantity
INT0015
INT0023
INT0032

May we get advice if it is possible to add table to standard business object?

Thank You.

Regards,

Chin Yee

entry.title: Order combination flag ignored in STO delivery creation (S/4 Public edition)
entry.content:
Dear experts,

We're facing the issue that the "Order combination" tickbox is ignored when creating deliveries for stock transfer PO's, although the flag is active in the STO line items. A function that has worked in older SAP versions without any issues, but doesn't seem to work in S/4 Public Edition. The suggestion was made to investigate the usage of BADI "LE_SHP_SUPPRESS_DEL_SPLIT"(Suppress Delivery Split), but that BADI only considers Sales order items (VBELN_VA), thus no Stock Transfer items.

The default delivery splitting criteria are all identical in the STO's we're shipping:

  • Shipping Point
  • Ship-to Party
  • Route
  • Shipping Conditions
  • Delivery Priority

Also, symptoms as described in note 3310234 - Delivery split is issued during replenishment delivery creation based on STO - SAP for Me are not applicable in our case. So, why are deliveries still created per STO in S/4HANA? Any suggestions/advice is welcome to resolve this issue.

Regards,
Corné

entry.title: How to Create a Custom Report for Purchase Orders with Approval Details in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
As part of a purchasing process optimization project, I needed to create a custom report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud that displays:

  • Purchase Order Number
  • Creation Date
  • Purchase Order Date
  • Approval Status
  • Approver Name

This report is essential for tracking the approval flow and identifying bottlenecks in the procurement process.

🔍 Approach

To achieve this, I used the Custom CDS Views app to build a tailored data source, and then created a Custom Analytical Query to visualize the data.

📘 CDS View Design

Primary Data Sources:

  • I_PurchaseOrder – for PO header details
  • I_PurchaseOrderApprovalStatus – for approval status
  • I_WorkflowTask or I_WorkflowInstance – to retrieve approver information

Key Fields Included:

  • PurchaseOrder
  • PurchaseOrderCreationDate
  • PurchaseOrderDate
  • ApprovalStatus
  • ApproverName (via workflow task assignment)

entry.title: Production variance settlement to CO-PA (instead of Cost center)
entry.content:
In S4HC Public by standard the production variance settlement (PRD) is posted against a profitability segment (CO-PA), whose profit center corresponds to the one maintained in the material master of the product manufactured. 

In S4HANA on-premise, we could configure the settlement so that a cost center (we called it "technical prices") was the receiver of the production variances (PRD), and when CKMLCP is executed, the PRY postings are made against that cost center, and together with the rest of PRD posting and other ML operations (transaction keys), the balance was 0 at period-end closing. If there was any balance in any material due to non-assigned/distributed price differences, we could easily assess them to CO-PA using allocation cycles. 

However, in S4HC Public, since the production variance (PRD) is posted against a PSG, the remaining amount in the "technical prices" cost center corresponds to that production variances + if there are any non-allocated/distributed balances, so that no automatic CO-PA allocation can be done, forcing the client to do manual posting to CO-PA (substracting manually the production variances amount) and besides we fail to the premise that all cost centers must be cleared out at period-end closing so that FI and CO result is the same.

How are you dealing with this matter in other clients? Can I do some kind of substitution to change PSG to cost center? Could SAP release the custo point to change the settlement as in on-premise? 

Thanks. Regards,

entry.title: SAP TRM Migration to Public Cloud – Cash Flow Transaction/Facility Object Missing?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I’m currently working on a migration project involving SAP TRM (Treasury and Risk Management) in the public cloud, and I’m looking for insights from anyone who has experience with this.

From the migration object list, I noticed that Interest Rate Instrument (IRI) and Letter of Credit (LoC) are included, which is great. However, I couldn’t find any mention of Cash Flow Transaction/Facility as a migration object.

Before I proceed further, I wanted to ask:

  • Has anyone here have an experience in migrating TRM objects to the public cloud?
  • Specifically, did you encounter the same issue with Cash Flow Transaction/Facility not being listed?
  • If this object is indeed not supported in the standard migration cockpit, did you end up using LSMW or another workaround?
  • Any lessons learned or recommendations would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!
